trans-unit.source: Manage passwords in Azure AD | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage passwords in Azure AD | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to manage passwords in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: How to manage passwords in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Manage passwords in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Manage passwords in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: If you are an administrator, you can reset a user’s password in Azure in the Azure classic portal.
trans-unit.target: If you are an administrator, you can reset a user’s password in Azure in the Azure classic portal.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of your directory and on the Users page, click the name of the user and at the bottom of the portal click **Reset Password**.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of your directory and on the Users page, click the name of the user and at the bottom of the portal click **Reset Password**.

trans-unit.source: This rest of this topic covers the full set of password management capabilities that Azure Active Directory supports, including:
trans-unit.target: This rest of this topic covers the full set of password management capabilities that Azure Active Directory supports, including:

trans-unit.source: **Self-service password** change allows end users or administrators to change their expired or non-expired passwords without calling an administrator or helpdesk for support.
trans-unit.target: **Self-service password** change allows end users or administrators to change their expired or non-expired passwords without calling an administrator or helpdesk for support.

trans-unit.source: **Self-service password** reset allows end users or administrators to reset their passwords automatically without calling an administrator or helpdesk for support.
trans-unit.target: **Self-service password** reset allows end users or administrators to reset their passwords automatically without calling an administrator or helpdesk for support.

trans-unit.source: Self-service password reset requires Azure AD Premium or Basic.
trans-unit.target: Self-service password reset requires Azure AD Premium or Basic.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Active Directory editions](active-directory-editions.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Active Directory editions](active-directory-editions.md).

trans-unit.source: **Administrator-initiated password reset** allows an administrator to reset an end user’s or another administrator’s password from within the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: **Administrator-initiated password reset** allows an administrator to reset an end user’s or another administrator’s password from within the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: **Password management activity reports** give administrators insights into password reset and registration activity occurring in their organization.
trans-unit.target: **Password management activity reports** give administrators insights into password reset and registration activity occurring in their organization.

trans-unit.source: **Password writeback** allows management of on-premises passwords from the cloud so all of the above scenarios can be performed by, or on the behalf of, federated or password synchronized users.
trans-unit.target: **Password writeback** allows management of on-premises passwords from the cloud so all of the above scenarios can be performed by, or on the behalf of, federated or password synchronized users.

trans-unit.source: Password writeback requires Azure AD Premium.
trans-unit.target: Password writeback requires Azure AD Premium.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Getting started with Azure Active Directory Premium](active-directory-get-started-premium.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Getting started with Azure Active Directory Premium](active-directory-get-started-premium.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Premium is available for Chinese customers using the world wide instance of Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Premium is available for Chinese customers using the world wide instance of Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Premium is not currently supported in the Microsoft Azure service operated by 21Vianet in China.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Premium is not currently supported in the Microsoft Azure service operated by 21Vianet in China.

trans-unit.source: For more information, contact us at the [Azure Active Directory Forum](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/169401-azure-active-directory).
trans-unit.target: For more information, contact us at the [Azure Active Directory Forum](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/169401-azure-active-directory).
